intro: Menkea villosula, commonly known as the hairy menkea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Menkea villosula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
